author: qizhou
content: Very nice video of introducing EIP-4444.  One quick question - instead of removing all historical header/body/receipts, why not keep the headers so that a node can (lightly) verify the canonical chain from genesis without weak subjectivity?

author: pietjepuk
content: How would keeping the headers around help with that?

author: qizhou
content: E.g., with headers, the node can verify TD from genesis to latest

author: pietjepuk
content: latest what? As soon as we move to PoS, there's no way around weak subjectivity. Someone might broadcast a perfectly valid-looking chain (with valid headers) that most of the network is not actually on.

author: qizhou
content: Understand the Merge will be different, but in the Merge case, should we also need to sync all headers of beacon chain?

author: qizhou
content: If someone broadcast a perfectly valid-looking chain, does that mean the BFT assumption is broken?

author: pietjepuk
content: Not sure what you mean by that, but you might want to read up on weak subjectivity and how there's not really any way around it (with headers or whatever). It's also not really related to <#953349957400821860> , so maybe a different channel makes more sense.

author: pietjepuk
content:
See also https://notes.ethereum.org/@adiasg/weak-subjectvity-eth2

(on the note of not being related to EIP-4444, I guess it _is_ somewhat related if we talk about the length of the weak subjectivity period vs. the oldest history we keep around)

author: qizhou
content: Cool.  Thanks.  Will take a look.

author: pietjepuk
content:
Not sure how accurate those estimates still are, there were some changes to leakage (quadratic on individual level) in Altair. Order of magnitude should be about the same though (not day, not years, but months).

Or maybe the lower bound is not related to that leakage at all, it's been a while. It only seems to reference the churn rate.
